pros: MC has a lovely campus, lovely faculty (mostly) and a fantastic location in the foothills of the Smoky Mountains. Faculty and administration tries very hard to provide an excellent student experience. Many staff are creative, energetic and positive people.  I have enjoyed working here for more than 10 years. Like the people I work with, like the physical aspects of the campus and like the students best of all.
cons: MC is getting there! The economic woes in 2008 and beyond were difficult and the administration had difficult decisions to make. Now hit with the COVID pandemic,  online classes are the norm with onsite labs. It is a difficult time for our students. Faculty and staff are doing their best to keep everyone safe while still providing the MC student experience they are known for. It is a hard time. Can't wait for COVID to go away or at least slow down.

pros: Supervisor finds the tutoring program that best fit my interests, flexible hours
cons: No cons as I was in college and this was a part-time job that fit me.

pros:
Great boss
Looks after his employees
Genuinely cares for his employees and the well-being of them

job_title: Professor Of English in Maryville, TN
pros: Gives education with individualized attention. Lots of opportunity to impact student lives by teaching well and developing good relationships with students.
cons: Lacks the economies of scale of a large, state-supported institution, so the college perpetually needs to keep its operations lean and efficient while still affording some deluxe items like individual faculty advising of a senior study for every student.

review_title: Doesn’t take care of their people
job_title: Event Support Coordinator in Maryville, TN
cons: If you don’t have a masters degree they won’t entertain any idea that is not their own.

job_title: Intramural Coordinator/Resident Director in Maryville, TN
pros: I appreciate the people I work directly with.  We offer each other support often.  You receive a lot of vacation time as a staff member as well.  In addition, you get the entire week of Christmas off.  Being a residence hall director, it is nice to have a free place to live and to be compensated for it as well.
cons: Sometimes it is frustrating when we try to make the school a better place but get trumped by a higher up.  The school tries to nickel and dime everything we do even if it may be a good purchase in the long run.  In addition, the judicial process is really disappointing.  There is little consistency to it which confused the student community which causes more problems.

pros: Wonderful administration and faculty. Small college so you get to know faculty and administrators.  Excellent students and the students really do make the college a great place to work!
cons: There are not any cons as far as I can see-- I really enjoyed my years at MC!

job_title: Instructional Technology Assistant in Maryville, TN
pros: The Director of Instructional Technology who was also my supervisor treats student nicely. He is very relaxing at work and always patiently trains students that work for him.
cons: There is totally no cons in my opinion

pros: There is a profound sense of community on Maryville's campus among staff, students and faculty.
cons: Opportunities for advancement for instructors looking to add job career experience.

pros: Opportunity to learn new skills and build your resume.
